name: Introduction to Political Science
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of political science, including key concepts, theories, and the various subfields of the discipline.

name: Introduction to Comparative Politics
description: This course introduces students to the field of comparative politics, including theories of comparative politics, methods of comparative analysis, and the major political systems of the world.

name: Political Economy
description: This course introduces students to the field of political economy, including theories of political economy, the political economy of development, and the role of the international economy on domestic political systems.

name: Advanced Political Economy
description: This course builds upon the concepts covered in the introductory political economy course, and introduces students to advanced topics such as international economic relations, economic development, and the global economy.
